Articles.Content:
How is LEGO City able to sustain it's own space program? An extremely successful one, at that. They're capable of launching satellites, space shuttles, and large scale missions to the Moon and MARS. How are they not a security threat? And where do they get the money? They have a coast guard, Sky Police, and they're able to build a rescue helicopter in mere seconds to save a man.

Edited March 21, 2023 by Kerbalsaurus

2 hours ago, Kerbalsaurus said:

How is LEGO City able to sustain it's own space program? An extremely successful one, at that. They're capable of launching satellites, space shuttles, and large scale missions to the Moon and MARS. How are they not a security threat? And where do they get the money? They have a coast guard, Sky Police, and they're able to build a rescue helicopter in mere seconds to save a man.

Funding from the Octan corporation  They make billions presumably.

5 hours ago, SunlitZelkova said:

Funding from the Octan corporation  They make billions presumably.

Don't forget, they have a significant engineering advantage as well. As the age old saying goes, "Rockets aren't Lego." Well, here, they literally are.
The question you really have to ask yourself is, "Who is the Master Builder?"
